newsitem.title: CANADA: Ontario kicks off bid to reform trust regulations.
newsitem.headline: Ontario kicks off bid to reform trust regulations.

text.p: The Conservative government of Ontario said on Wednesday that it plans to streamline regulations governing trust companies in Canada's most populous province.
Finance Minister Ernie Eves earlier today released a discussion paper on the future of Ontario's trust company regulations.

"The province is seeking input on more efficient ways of protecting consumers, including the possibility of delegating enforcement of provincial regulatory rules to federal officials," Eves said in a statement.
The government is also seeking comment on whether there is a need for Ontario to provide for provincial incorporation of trust firms.

"Our goals are to ensure consumers continue to be protected, that companies can compete without the unnecessary constraints and costs of complying with two sets of rules and that small businesses have greater access to capital," Eves said.
The trust industry in Canada is dominated by the country's six major banks.
